channel.title: The Ice
channel.description:
[b]I know that this thread is going to last for that long. I will request lock in about a two week period or depending on the amount of activity on this thread. Please do not bother with something stated that I know about already. I'm aware that this thread will not last that long.[/b]
Alright, at the moment, the whole entire county school's have been closed due to ice. So seeing as I have a day off, I can get some things done.
Discussion Topic: Do you have it bad were you live? What are your plans if school is out? What is your plans if work is out? What are the conditions? etc
[b]Do not hesitate to comment on others activity.[/b]
Please remain on topic, I will request lock early if needed.

item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

The first time it rained in Georgia. We began to have like a centimeter of snow, and then the roads and stuff began to freeze. Then after that happened, we had gotten another shower of rain.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ice
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

We get rain in Egypt.
Meh we never actually go below 10 degrees Celsius here, so no snow for us…
The weather sucks though, cold (for us at any rate) and really dusty.

Read full topic

item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

No snow yet… and I live in New Hampshire. -.-

We’re suppose to be getting a shit load of snow either Sunday night or Monday morning so I am hoping that we’ll have a snow day.

Read full topic

item.description:
@flj0yter0p wrote:

Alot of snow here, freezing, if you stay outside for like 30 minutes you can’t feel your fingers, especialy legs.

And i still go to school, good thing there’s a holiday 24th

item.title: The Ice
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

noobs are ftw:

Pwned^

It’s good and bad. Bad being because school sucks, but good because we won’t have to make up anymore days in July when school gets out.

Delays - Do not have to make up.
Days off - Do have to make up.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ice
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

We have around a foot and a half of snow at the moment, but we have only had a single 2-hour delay due to snow on the roads that hadn’t been plowed yet. Our school rarely gives us a snow day, even when school around us is canceled, just because we won some blue ribbon thing signifying a good school.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ice
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Ix Soulcist xI:

I don’t understand how New York is not getting a lot of snow. It’s not like New York to not get a lot of it.

Duh haven’t you ever heard of global warming. This is obviously significant signs of an impending ice age.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ice
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“kryst-scape, post:30, topic:373509”]We had Monday, Tuesday, AND Wednesday off from school this week. I live on Michigan’s East coast, so all the bad weather Michigan gets, we get it twice as bad due to the wind blowing off the great lakes. The drifts were bad on the back roads, took 3 days to clean it up. The drifts were easily over my brother’s head, and he’s 5’3 tall. So it was pretty bad, expecting more snow this weekend.

Oh, and we didnt get ice too bad. [/quote]
Again, Lansing got nothing but a little ice Sunday night.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ice
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:27, topic:373509”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=469521.msg3433946#msg3433946 date=1292594176]
The past 2 few days it got down in the 20’s and 30’s out in the county, Which was pretty cool, now its gonna be hot until winter I believe.
[/quote]
and it’s crazy how its nearly 80 degrees today.[/quote]Yeah I know, its really annoying over 50k worth of crops have been lost cause of it.

Read full topic

item.title: The Ice
item.dc:creator: @kryst-scape kryst-scape
item.description:
@kryst-scape wrote:

We had Monday, Tuesday, AND Wednesday off from school this week. I live on Michigan’s East coast, so all the bad weather Michigan gets, we get it twice as bad due to the wind blowing off the great lakes. The drifts were bad on the back roads, took 3 days to clean it up. The drifts were easily over my brother’s head, and he’s 5’3 tall. So it was pretty bad, expecting more snow this weekend.

Oh, and we didnt get ice too bad.

Read full topic
